image.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the opinion people have of a person, organization, product etc, or the way a person, organization etc seems to be to the public
image.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: attempts to improve the image of the police
image.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a picture that you have in your mind, especially about what someone or something is like or the way they look
image.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He had the clearest image in his mind of his mother and father.
He had no visual image of her, only her name.
image.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a picture of an object in a mirror or in the lens of a camera
image.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: She peered closely at her image in the mirror.
image.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a picture on the screen of a television, cinema, or computer
image.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Jill Sharpe was little more than a name, a glossy image on a television screen.
image.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a picture or shape of a person or thing that is copied onto paper or is cut in wood or stone
image.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a word, phrase, or picture that describes an idea in a poem, book, film etc
image.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: He paints a very romantic image of working-class communities.
image.translation[0].note_box[0].section: We want to give people a positive image of the town.
It’s difficult to explain why the industry has such a bad image.
Many negative images of women are found in the media.
The recent scandal has damaged his clean-cut image.
The company is trying to promote an upmarket image.
The store has struggled to break away from its downmarket image.
They want to improve the traditional image of English food.
The popular image of the spy as a glamorous figure of mystery is far from the reality.
Her public image does not reflect the way she behaves in private.
He had cultivated a screen image as a ruthless tough guy.
He was keen to project a macho image in this film.
The product has a rather downmarket image.
The company is trying to create an image of quality and reliability.
The casino industry was keen to improve its image.
Has this scandal damaged the company’s image?
He has certainly lived up to his wild rock-star image.
He presented an image of himself as an energetic young leader.
He was trying to cultivate an image of himself as an intellectual.
His behaviour has tarnished the image of the sport.
The pop star promised to clean up his image after he was released from prison.
The party struggled to lose its image of being somewhat old-fashioned.
Politicians have an image problem as far as many young people are concerned.
image.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the general opinion that most people have of a person, organization, product etc
image.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Law suits hurt a company’s image and may hinder future fund raising.
A good advertising campaign will promote a company’s corporate image while reminding consumers of the products it makes.
image.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a picture on the screen of a computer or television
image.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: A small company is leading the way in using lasers to create three-dimensional models from computer images.
